column4: After installing phpmyadmin, where should I point my browser to use it?
hm, maybe it needs to be started up...
No, it shouldn't need to be started. Are you getting a 404 error?
Yes, a 404. (and btw, the process is running)
Very strange. I've got phpmyadmin running fine on my machine and there's no process.
Not that you should have to, but have you tried restarting Apache since installing pma?
yeah, I misunderstood what I was looking at
You've checked that it's properly installed? whereis phpmyadmin
phpmyadmin: /etc/phpmyadmin /usr/share/phpmyadmin ... it did whinge about a badly put together package when installing
using an old style of packaging or something? I can reinstall to get the text if you like (& actually, it said to complain to the package maintainer anyways)
No harm in purge & reinstall I guess. I've got pma running without issue on both Hardy and Jaunty, though, so it's a bit strange.
k, I'll do that... thanks anyways
